001package com.technototes.library.hardware;
002
003import static com.technototes.library.hardware.HardwareDevice.hardwareMap;
004
005import com.qualcomm.ftccommon.SoundPlayer;
006import java.util.HashMap;
007import java.util.Map;
008import javax.annotation.Nullable;
009
010/**
011 * There's just no possible way I care about this. I think there are rules about *not* playing
012 * anything through the speaker now, anyway. This is going away.
013 */
014@Deprecated
015public class Speaker {
016
017    private final Map<String, Integer> list;
018
019    private String currentSong = null;
020
021    public Speaker(String... songs) {
022        this(1f, songs);
023    }
024
025    public Speaker(float volume, String... songs) {
026        list = new HashMap<>();
027        addSongs(songs);
028        setVolume(volume);
029    }
030
031    public Speaker addSongs(String... name) {
032        for (String s : name) {
033            list.put(
034                s,
035                hardwareMap.appContext
036                    .getResources()
037                    .getIdentifier(s, "raw", hardwareMap.appContext.getPackageName())
038            );
039        }
040        return this;
041    }
042
043    public Speaker start(String name) {
044        SoundPlayer.getInstance().startPlaying(hardwareMap.appContext, list.get(name));
045        currentSong = name;
046        return this;
047    }
048
049    public Speaker stop() {
050        SoundPlayer.getInstance().stopPlayingAll();
051        currentSong = null;
052        return this;
053    }
054
055    public Speaker setVolume(float volume) {
056        SoundPlayer.getInstance().setMasterVolume(volume);
057        return this;
058    }
059
060    public float getVolume() {
061        return SoundPlayer.getInstance().getMasterVolume();
062    }
063
064    @Nullable
065    public String getCurrentSong() {
066        return currentSong;
067    }
068}
